meanings.sent1: The table was wobbly on the uneven floor.
meanings.sent2: She felt wobbly on her feet after spinning around.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly chair made funny noises whenever someone sat on it.
meanings.sent4: His confidence in the project was as wobbly as a house of cards.
meanings.sent5: The wobbly bridge swayed in the wind, making it scary to cross.

meanings.sent1: The old bookshelf was wobbly and could collapse any moment.
meanings.sent2: The wobbly ladder was not safe to climb.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly jelly on the plate made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her wobbly decision-making led to many mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The wobbly ground beneath them felt like walking on a trampoline.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of weakness or uncertainty
meanings.sent1: His wobbly voice betrayed his nervousness during the speech.
meanings.sent2: The wobbly excuse he gave was not convincing.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly plan fell apart as soon as it was implemented.
meanings.sent4: Her wobbly resolve crumbled under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The wobbly smile on his face showed his inner turmoil.
